column4: anyone know how to send emails anonymously via evolution or any other linux mail program
herbs: i don't want to spam
no, you cannot send emails anonymously throgh Gmail, unless you create a separate account. Maybe they look anonymous to you, but they are not. Disclamer: I work in computer security
what if i send it through tor with namoroka?
also i am not so concerned if google knows where things are coming from.  i am more concerned with the immediate parties that i am in contact with that could possible blow my cover
no, tor just protects your ip. The thing is, the email still carries meta information about the sender. the correct tool for the job is "mixmaster"
it's in the repos
invernizzI: downloading now. how do i use it
mixmaster strips metadata from emails and forwards the email from server to server to delay it and make it untraceable
herbs: not a spammer
herbs: troll somewhere else please
just launch it, it's pretty self explanatory. keep in mind that the delay between sending and receipt can be of hours. the purpose is to avoid to leak even the time of sending
what servers should i connect it to
i have 5 options in the install. not sure which one to choose
tell me which options are there
herbs: i do not answer to you, and did not appreciate your incorrect assessment
no configuration, internet site, internet with smarthost, satellite system, local only
local
herbs: spammers use botnets to send emails, not remailers. Trust me, this is not the system to send spam. Again, I work exaclty on malware and spam
i sent you a private message with a website that i am involved with.
